The access is recommended via the upper of the two paths and is very bumpy with larger rocks, but also possible without a 4x4.

title: (23210) Zocueca - A-4
description:
Rest area on the way, behind a gas station and an abandoned restaurant. Close to the road but not too noisy and next to a river. Recommended for one night and follow the route.
The gas station is very cheap, it has gas, you can take free water and rubbish.
There are no trucks, so it is quieter than other areas near the highway.

title: (23210) Zocueca -
description: Service station, it has restrooms for public use in good condition. They let us fill the water tank and although they don't have a place to discharge water, they told us that we could discharge gray water on a piece of land that they have attached to the station.

name: Mirador del embalse del Jándula
title: (23748) Mirador del embalse del Jándula
description:
A stunning space for up to 3 vans.  A peaceful and tranquil stay immersed in nature with Eagles and Vultures flying overhead and the opportunity to spot Lnyx and Deer. 
It is at the end of a 10KM rough track but the vista is worth every bump. 
The reason why we camp offgrid.

No water or bins so you bring what you need and take home what you used. 

Popular are for fishing and wildlife spotting.

title: (23740) Andújar - JF-5004
description: Parking at the end of La Lancha road (gravel and potholed but drivable) famous among lynx watchers. The parking is right by the dam so expect some gentle noise at night. Good shade in the afternoon from big eucalyptus trees. The parking is quite popular during the weekends but nobody stayed overnight in March. We have a pleasant week there without problems. A nice short walk starts right from the parking - good for birdwatching and watching ibex up the rocks. For birdwatching, you can also cross the dam and walk along the road. There are turtles in the lake. If you are in this area for lynx watching this is a perfect place for a night. Just 15 minutes drive back in the direction of farms and the main road there are three lookouts to observe lynxes (if you are lucky). We saw only one during our week-long stay. Other wildlife such as red deers, fallow deers, mouflons are present. Spanish imperial eagle is possible too from the lookouts. Definitely, a perfect place for a prolonged stay, especially if you are a nature lover. The parking is spacey enough even for several big motorhomes. There are no services, no source of water and no rubbish bin. You have to be fully self-sufficient to enjoy this place.

title: (23440) Baeza - 24 Calle Miguel de Unamuno
description: laundromat

It is a large esplanade of land, with a supermarket opposite (Mercadona, with toilets inside) and several laundries. 15 minutes walk from the center. You can park both during the day and overnight. During the course of the guards (October / May) there are quite a few cars during the week, on weekends it is emptied. Children's play area and dirt soccer field. There are dirt roads that lead from there towards the olive groves, perfect for walking with dogs.

title: (23740) Andújar -
description: Cute picnic area next to the chapel and there are a few ruins. In the middle of nature, very calm, we spent a night there without problem. Lots of room but the ground is not very flat, we found a place at the top of the hill. Correct route to reach it.

title: (13750) Castellar de Santiago - 48 Calle Bailén
description: Unattended AC's area, with all payment services by bank card. Created by the Provincial Council of Ciudad Real. Located next to the bullring.

title: (23740) Andújar - A-6178
description: Small clearing along the road without traffic (2 cars in 10h). Important presence of deer that can be observed at any time of the day. A delight.

title: (23639) Las Infantas - 15 Calle Francisco del Moral
title_short: (23639) Las Infantas - 15 Calle Francisco del Moral
description: Reasonable area to stay overnight enroute to Madrid from southern Spain.

title: (13730) Santa Cruz de Mudela - 110 Poblado Nuestra Sra de las Virtud
title_short: (13730) Santa Cruz de Mudela - 110 Poblado Nuestra Sra de las Virtud
description: Small motorway area with shop, gas station, toilets, restaurant and ... showers!

address.street: 110 Poblado Nuestra Sra de las Virtud

title: (13730) Santa Cruz de Mudela - 12 Paseo Castelar
title_short: (13730) Santa Cruz de Mudela - 12 Paseo Castelar
description: Big parking área in a quiet town (during the day) where to have a rest. Very close to a beautiful municipal park with playgrounds, fountains and benches.

title: (23740) Andújar - 333 Calle Minguillos
description: Public car parks next to Hospital. Wide, without shade, illuminated at night, discreet.

title: (13593) Solana del Pino -
description: Helipad level esplanade and behind the cemetery. Next to the town. Good starting point for excursions and as a base to get to know the Valle de Alcudia and Sierra Madrona natural park. You go down a paved road in good condition. At the beginning of this street there are garbage cans and a fountain. In the village bakery, butcher, honey, bars. The town wants motorhome tourism, please respect the parking area.

title: (23740) Andújar - 1 Avenida de Londres
description: Parking next to the gas station, shopping center, McDonalds and Burguering, Multicines, Café-Restautante, Hotel and just at the roundabout of the road that goes up to the Sierra Morena and the Virgen de la Cabeza Sanctuary.

title: (23740) Andújar - 11 Avenida Blás Infante
description: Parking in the street near supermarkets, gas stations, parking lots. It is quiet and on a street with little traffic.

title: (13593) Solana del Pino - Calle Primero de Mayo
title_short: (13593) Solana del Pino - Calle Primero de Mayo
description: Nice parking and free night for 8 motorhomes, in a natural point of view with a fantastic view of the Sierra Madrona, located near the municipal swimming pool. A wonder to enjoy the nature of the Alcudia Valley and the Sierra Madrona Natural Park

title: (23740) Andújar - 5 Calle Sector Andalucia
description: Laundry, it has hours from 8:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. but is open every day of the year

title: (23746) Lahiguera - 6 Calle Iglesia
description: Parked for a night. Needed to be in area for training and no spots found so far, so parked here for a night. Calm, straight and safe. Few barking dogs and views over the olive fields.

title: (13300) - 211 A-4
description: Parking area managed by the General Directorate of Traffic, with a direct exit from the motorway heading south. It has many parking spaces for vehicles but more adjusted for motorhomes. It has several bathrooms with showers, picnic tables, filling and emptying of sewage as it has a treatment plant. At the entrance there is an information office. Place of prayer for Muslims. It is only open in summer to cross the strait, a pity that it is not open all year.

title: (23320) Torreperogil -
description: Picnic spot..Drive through.  I did not spend the night. 2 picnic tables at the side of the road.Signposted on approach.Room  for small or large vehicle. Small number of trees for shade.

title: (13380) - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of the castle of Calatrava. ATTENTION: Only from the afternoon of Sunday to Tuesday morning, since the castle closes on Monday.The rest of the days are usually full during the day, although late in the afternoon any day is good. The views are simply spectacular. Without any service except the bin.

title: (13730) Santa Cruz de Mudela - 210 A-4
description: It is called La Pará Rociera, it is a gas station where you can fill water with a short hose, a store and restaurant with good prices and large sandwiches ... some shady tree to eat and rest in the cool

title: (13370) Calzada de Calatrava - 166 Calle Cervantes
description: Parking in the street, without problems, in front of one of the most beautiful painted silos of the Titanes project. Quiet place, although on business days it can be a bit noisy because there is a school in front.

title: (23180) Fuerte del Rey -
description: Small parking next to a picnic area, quiet place next to the road (little traffic) maximum 4 vans or motorhomes.

title: (23530) Jimena - 703 A-320
description: A small space to park and sleep. They fit about 4 small motorhomes. in case there is no one else a large motorhome alone too. the very quiet place, you can park there for the climb to the farm cave with cave paintings, but to see it before you have to talk to the town hall to be open. you have to follow the signs for the football field, and just in front (a little abandoned) is the site. Municipal swimming pools are just where you start climbing (only in summer). We spent the night on a very quiet Saturday in November

name: Camping El Cantonet
title: (23538) Camping El Cantonet
description: Camping El Cantonet - Warm welcome at the family campsite. Large shaded pitches. Easy to get to and well signposted. wifi and electricity. Recently renovated campsite with swimming pool and large living room with tv.

title: (23537) Bedmar - 10 Carretera Mancha Real a Cazorla
title_short: (23537) Bedmar - 10 Carretera Mancha Real a Cazorla
description: Parking in dirt but very passable with beautiful views of the mountains and olive groves. walk up about 200 m on the sidewalk and you arrive at a fountain, there you go through a park and you arrive at the main square. restaurant and shops. from there, continue up the small streets to the church and the remains of the castle. take good shoes because it climbs hard. good visit.

title: (23538) Albanchez de Mágina - J-3105
description: Parking next to the Hutar recreation and leisure area, a hotel and a restaurant. With tables, sports area and fountains. Quite quiet both day and night (although on weekends and in summer with more movement). Good option as a base to visit both Albanchez and Sierra Mágina.

title: (23100) Mancha Real - S/N Calle la Lonja
title_short: (23100) Mancha Real - S/N Calle la Lonja
description: Parking next to the Civil Guard barracks. It has two picnic areas. There is another parking lot opposite, a park, a Día supermarket and a Bp. Without services, many car parks.

title: (23100) Mancha Real - A-320
description: Free parking. With picnic areas and painted on the ground for children's games
